title: Three women, one man injured in downtown Denver shootout
content:
DENVER -- A shooting in downtown Denver left three women and one man injured early Monday morning, the Denver Police Department said. By Monday evening, two remained in the hospital and two had been treated and released. Everyone was expected to recover.
Police were looking for witnesses who might lead them to suspects who fired weapons. The shooting happened between 2:30 a.m. and 2:45 a.m. in a parking lot at 19th and Blake streets, just as nightclubs and bars were letting out.
About 30 to 40 shell casings were recovered from the scene as police conducted an investigation.
Police also secured an area five blocks away at 18th and Arapahoe streets where a white Escalade was found with bullet holes in the passenger door. Police said the SUV is related to the shooting at 19th and Blake.
Police have not released any information on any suspects, only saying there could be multiple shooters.
